moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4: The game opens with a King's Gambit.
moves.2... d5: Black declines the gambit and offers a counter gambit.
moves.3... e4 4. Nc3 Nf6: Here, White should play d3, but plays a weird move instead.
moves.5. h3 Bb4 6. Nge2 O-O 7. a3 Bxc3 8. Nxc3: Black is better in this position. White will have to fight for equality.
moves.20. Qh5 Be6 21. Rec1: White should have moved the other rook.
moves.21... Qd7 22. Qg5 Re7 23. Ra2 Rf7 24. Rc: White doubles rooks behind his own pawn.
moves.28... Ke8 29. Qg6 Kd8 30. Kf2 Kc8: Black runs to the Queenside, not realizing that he was actually safer on the Kingside.
